DataElement.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Computed Tomography Abdominal  Cavity Medical Imaging Prior Therapy Assessment Date
DataElement.preferredDefinition: the date related to the medical imaging assessment of the upper portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis using magnetic resonance imaging, a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body, or computed tomograhpy, series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body; the pictures are created by a computer linked to an x-ray machine prior to the start or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Computed Tomography Abdominal  Cavity Medical Imaging Prior Therapy Assessment
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the medical imaging assessment of the upper portion of the body that lies between the thorax and the pelvis using magnetic resonance imaging, a procedure in which a magnet linked to a computer is used to create detailed pictures of areas inside the body, or computed tomograhpy, series of detailed pictures of areas inside the body; the pictures are created by a computer linked to an x-ray machine prior to the start or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Magnetic Resonance Imaging Computed Tomography Abdominal Cavity Medical Imaging
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide amazingly clear and detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders. :A method of examining body organs by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis. :(AB-do-men) The area of the body that contains the pancreas, stomach, intestine, liver, gallbladder, and other organs.:In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Concepts.definition: Imaging that uses radiofrequency waves and a strong magnetic field rather than x-rays to provide detailed pictures of internal organs and tissues. The technique is valuable for the diagnosis of many pathologic conditions, including cancer, heart and vascular disease, stroke, and joint and musculoskeletal disorders.
A method of examining structures within the body by scanning them with X rays and using a computer to construct a series of cross-sectional scans along a single axis.
The cavity located between the lungs and pelvis. It contains the lower esophagus, stomach, pancreas, intestines, liver, gallbladder and spleen.
In medicine, any technology which helps in visualization of any biological process, cell, tissue or organ for the screening, diagnosis, surgical procedure or therapy.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:Examination of the body by auscultation, palpation, percussion, inspection, and olfaction.  (Taber's)

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

A systemic evaluation of the body and its functions using visual inspection, palpation, percussion and auscultation. The purpose is to determine the presence or absence of physical signs of disease or abnormality for an individual's health assessment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The date on which an observation was made or an event occurred.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: a particular day specified as the time something has, or will, happen.

Concepts.definition: The particular day, month and year an event has happened or will happen.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/3/17 tt added Diagnosis CSI. 6/20/17 jk transferred to NCI Standards per confirmation by Brian Campbell as part of Round 5 finalization task, added reg status.
